thread.title: Brookvale Oval's bizarre re-name | League | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Brookvale Oval's bizarre re-name | League | Sporting News

author: Adam Lucius
title: Brookvale Oval's bizarre re-name | League | Sporting News
text:
Published on Feb. 2, 2017 
Updated at 3:44 a.m. ET 
Brookvale Oval is no longer. 
For the next three years, Manly’s home ground of 60 years will be known as - wait for it - Lottoland. 
Lottoland is an online lottery game based in the US. 
The Sea Eagles’ decision to take their sponsorship dollars has attracted plenty of controversy, but CEO Tim Cleary defended the move. 
"Lottoland sponsors the Australian Open tennis and Australian cricket and we are happy to sit beside those iconic sports," he told Sporting News. 
"This is a commercial decision and one we entered into with great enthusiasm." 
The deal is worth seven figures and is being hailed as a ‘lifesaver’ by the club. 
"It ensures the Manly-Warringah Sea Eagles remain on the northern beaches," Cleary said. 
"This is a significant deal and a significant day in the club's history. 
"The atmosphere and history of the The Fortress remains and we hope to again make it a place where other teams hate to visit." 
Cleary added Lottoland was keen to be part of the planned refurbishment of Brookvale Oval, rated the worst ground in the NRL for facilities. 
More to come.
